title: Ticket #1516: new ClassAds don't support semicolon as function argument separator
description:
In old ClassAds, arguments to a function can be separated with commas or semicolons. In new ClassAds, only commas can be used. In old ClassAds, the use of semicolons is an older syntax that is now avoided, but still valid.

We've identified two users of Condor who use the semicolon notation. They are the Swift workload management system (https://svn.ci.uchicago.edu/svn/vdl2/usertools/swift/osgedu-list-sites) and the ReSS service of OSG. As such, we should make new ClassAds recognize this notation when in old ClassAd compatibility mode (i.e. when _useOldClassAdSemantics is set to true).
